name: DeleteDataObject
description:
Delete a data object from a specified collection using its UUID.

Use this tool to remove a specific data object from a Weaviate collection, identified by its `className` and `id` (UUID). Useful for managing data within a Weaviate instance.

parameters.name: collection_name
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.

value_schema.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.

parameters.name: object_uuid
parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be deleted from the collection.

value_schema.description: Unique UUID of the object to be deleted.

parameters.name: replica_acknowledgment_level
parameters.description: Specifies the number of replicas needed to confirm request success.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

parameters.name: tenant_identifier
parameters.description: Specifies the tenant when targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

value_schema.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: consistency_level
parameters.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

value_schema.description: Determines how many replicas must acknowledge a request before it is considered successful.

parameters.name: tenant
parameters.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

value_schema.description: Specifies the tenant in a request targeting a multi-tenant collection (class).

parameters.name: className
parameters.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.

value_schema.description: Name of the collection (class) the object belongs to.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Unique UUID of the object to be deleted.

value_schema.description: Unique UUID of the object to be deleted.
